name: 4. The Long Walk Home.
description:
"When we moved to this place nearly a decade ago, this road was our introduction. So rugged and untamed, rocky and steep. Visitors with 2wd vehicles always commented on it being a challenge, fairly it was. After the fires had passed and we were ready to return, I couldn't help but think of the irony. Tree's were still burning and falling, crashing down and echoing in the distance, there was no vehicle in existence that could make the trek now. So we walked, mostly in silence. Preparing ourselves for what we would find on the other side."

Photography by Jay Moon, during the Australian wildfires; November 2019.
#4 of 15.
All funds generated go toward the ongoing recovery.
